designScenario.name: SmartFlight Navigation System
designScenario.description: Design an advanced Navigation System for modern aircraft, integrating artificial intelligence (AI) for real-time path optimization, multi-sensor fusion, and autonomous navigation capabilities. This system must provide precise positioning, adaptive route planning considering weather and air traffic, and enhanced situational awareness while ensuring robustness through redundancy and fail-safe mechanisms. The system must interface with autopilot systems and provide intuitive pilot controls.

details.description: The system must use AI algorithms to dynamically adjust flight paths in response to real-time weather, air traffic, and airspace restrictions.
Optimize fuel efficiency by selecting the most efficient routes based on wind patterns and altitude profiles.
Achieve horizontal positional accuracy of ±3 meters and vertical accuracy of ±10 meters.
Maintain navigation data update rates of at least 20 Hz for high-dynamic flight scenarios.
Implement quad-redundant sensor arrays for GPS, inertial navigation, and terrain referencing systems.
Trigger automatic terrain avoidance maneuvers if a collision threat is detected within 30 seconds.
Provide a touchscreen-based user interface with 3D terrain visualization and augmented reality overlays for navigation cues.
Support over-the-air software updates and predictive maintenance via self-diagnostic health monitoring.

systemComponents.name: Flight Management Computer (FMC)
systemComponents.description: Central processing unit managing navigation algorithms, sensor fusion, and flight control interfaces.

subComponents.name: AI Navigation Core
subComponents.description: Dedicated hardware for real-time AI path optimization and threat detection.

subComponents.name: Sensor Fusion Processor
subComponents.description: Module integrating GPS, inertial, and terrain data into a unified navigation solution.

systemComponents.name: Multi-Constellation GNSS Receiver
systemComponents.description: Primary positioning system supporting GPS, Galileo, GLONASS, and BeiDou constellations.

subComponents.name: High-Sensitivity Antenna Array
subComponents.description: Dual-polarized antenna for optimal satellite signal reception.

subComponents.name: RTK Differential Correction Unit
subComponents.description: Enhances positional accuracy using ground-based correction signals.

systemComponents.name: Inertial Navigation System (INS)
systemComponents.description: Provides dead-reckoning capabilities during GPS signal loss.

subComponents.name: Fiber-Optic Gyroscopes
subComponents.description: High-precision rotational sensors for angular rate measurement.

subComponents.name: MEMS Accelerometers
subComponents.description: Micro-electromechanical accelerometers for linear motion tracking.

systemComponents.name: Terrain Awareness and Warning Subsystem (TAWS)
systemComponents.description: Monitors terrain elevation and obstacles to prevent controlled flight into terrain (CFIT).

subComponents.name: Digital Elevation Database
subComponents.description: Stores high-resolution global terrain elevation data.

subComponents.name: Collision Threat Processor
subComponents.description: Analyzes flight path against terrain data to generate avoidance advisories.

systemComponents.name: Air Data Inertial Reference Unit (ADIRU)
systemComponents.description: Fuses inertial data with airspeed, altitude, and attitude information.

systemComponents.name: Satellite Communication Module
systemComponents.description: Enables high-bandwidth data links for weather updates and air traffic control communications.

subComponents.name: Ka-Band Satellite Transceiver
subComponents.description: Supports high-speed data transfer via geostationary satellites.

subComponents.name: VHF Data Link (VDL) Modem
subComponents.description: Facilitates digital voice and data communication with air traffic control.

systemComponents.name: Pilot Display System
systemComponents.description: Primary interface for pilots to view navigation data and control system parameters.

subComponents.name: Head-Up Display (HUD)
subComponents.description: Projected transparent display overlaying the pilot's forward view.

subComponents.name: Multi-Function Control Panel
subComponents.description: Touchscreen interface for route adjustments and system configuration.

relationships.description: The FMC aggregates GPS positioning data from the GNSS receiver for navigation solutions.
The FMC integrates inertial navigation data during GPS outages for continuity.
The FMC relies on TAWS data to compute terrain clearance and avoidance paths.
The communication module provides real-time weather and traffic data to the FMC.
The FMC fuses ADIRU data for accurate altitude and attitude calculations.
The FMC outputs navigation data to the pilot displays for situational awareness.
The redundant sensors provide backup positioning and inertial data to the FMC.

attributes.name: PositionalAccuracyHorizontal
attributes.description: Horizontal positional accuracy under optimal conditions.

attributes.name: DataUpdateRate
attributes.description: Minimum navigation data update frequency for high-dynamic maneuvers.

attributes.name: RedundancyLevel
attributes.description: Four independent sensor channels for critical navigation functions.

attributes.name: AIProcessingSpeed
attributes.description: Computational power of the AI navigation core for real-time path optimization.

attributes.name: CommunicationProtocols
attributes.description: Supported communication protocols for data and voice transmission.

attributes.name: TerrainDatabaseCoverage
attributes.description: Resolution and coverage of the TAWS terrain database.

attributes.name: LatencyThreshold
attributes.description: Maximum allowable latency between sensor input and display output.

diagramType.description: SysML 图的类型，固定为 BDD (块定义图)

comments.body: This block represents the entire GPS subsystem of the aircraft, including signal reception, processing, and navigation data generation.
